{"step_by_step_thinking": "The sphenoidal air sinus is a part of the paranasal sinuses. According to Document [0], the innervation of the sphenoidal sinuses is provided by the posterior ethmoidal branch of the ophthalmic nerve [V1], and the maxillary nerve [V2] via orbital branches from the pterygopalatine ganglion. Document [1] and Document [9] also confirm that the sphenoidal sinuses are innervated by the ophthalmic and maxillary nerve. Therefore, the correct answer should be the posterior ethmoidal nerve.", "answer_choice": "A"}
